title: Traveller shames airport eatery over sandwich
text:
Traveller shames airport eatery over sandwich Last updated 12:08, July 1 2015 Spambox 
This bacon and egg roll wasn't quite what the man expected. 
A hungry traveller was so disappointed in his airport meal that he decided to go online to vent his frustration. 
The man bought a bacon and egg roll for Â£3.20 (NZ$7.40) at Edinburgh Airport's EAT, a popular sandwich chain, but was shocked by the distinct lack of filling, The Daily Mail reported . 
Under the username "spambox", he posted a photograph of the pricey roll on social media, which prompted both jokes and sympathy from other online commenters. 
"What are they using - hummingbird eggs?" asked one. 
"Times are tough, man," said another. 
Others pointed out that the sandwich wasn't all that surprising, given its location: "It is airport food. What did you expect?" 
READ MORE: Air NZ customer cheesed off at inflight snack 
To make matters worse, the man said he waited for 15 minutes before having to go back and ask what had happened to the roll, "which they had totally forgotten about". 
However, he declined to ask for a refund, saying he thought "it must just be overpriced s*** cause it's an airport". 
Yet his posts prove he was also able to see the humour in the situation:"As miffed as I was about the terrible service, as soon as I opened it, I burst out laughing, as did my girlfriend because, well, look at it. It's so bad it's funny." 
The Daily Mail said Edinburgh Airport planned to address the complaint with EAT. It was also in the process of trying to track down the customer to offer compensation. - Stuff
